title: Lorraine Bracco didn’t see ‘Goodfellas’ until 2016
text:
Lorraine Bracco was one of the last people in the world to see “Goodfellas.”
The 62-year-old actress, who starred in the mafia movie in 1990, missed the flick when it was first released and then just never caught up.
“Well, I went to the premiere, but I missed the start doing interviews, and then they pulled me out before the end, and then I had another job on a film with Sean Connery in the f--king jungle,” she told The Guardian . “And by the time I came home it wasn’t playing. And I never wanted to see it on TV.”
She skipped the 25th anniversary screening in New York in 2015, too.
25 things you didn’t know about ‘Goodfellas’ 
“And finally I see it last summer, outdoors in LA” at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery, she said. “Four thousand people, a full moon. And me.”
Bracco, who played Karen Hill, the wife of mobster Henry Hill (Ray Liotta), said she never even auditioned for her role.
The 62-year-old actress also took some shots at President Trump. (Steve Granitz/WireImage) Instead, director Martin Scorsese remembered her from an “After Hours” audition five years prior.
“Here’s the thing. My father was Italian-American and my mother was a war bride. English, from Oxford. And I was born in Brooklyn but we moved to a Jewish neighborhood on Long Island,” she told The Guardian . “So I knew the Italian world and the Jewish world. That helped. I am a true immigrant, Mr. Trump!”
Goodfella Paul Sorvino says Trump is a fine fellow 
As for the President, Bracco said she was never impressed.
“I’ve met him in New York. Never my kind of guy. Always very arrogant. But it doesn’t feel like a different America yet, because we’re still protesting,” she said.
“It’s white American men, middle-class but not as successful as they think they should be. They look at him and say, ‘My God, I wanna be like him. I want my own TV show. My own plane. My wife that never talks!’”
